intro: Oxytropis campestris var. chartacea, commonly known as the silky field vetch, is a flowering plant native to dry, open habitats in the western United States. It is a perennial legume characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish pea-like flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
